titleInfo.title: File 6391/1928 'Persia and the Persian Gulf: method of counteracting Soviet activities on Persia and the Persian Gulf'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.The subject 'Method of Counteracting Soviet Activities in Persia and the Persian Gulf' consists of one volume.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 78; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. A previous foliation sequence, which is also circled, has been superseded and therefore crossed out.

mods.abstract: The file contains the subject 'Method of Counteracting Soviet Activities in Persia and the Persian Gulf'.The papers cover Russian propaganda in Persia, Soviet commercial activities in southern Persia and in the Persian Gulf, and Bolshevik activities in Abadan and Mohammerah [Khorramshahr].The principal correspondents are: the Secretary of State for India; the India Office; the Foreign Office; the British Vice-Consulate at Mohammerah; and the British Legation at Tehran.
